description.narrative: The Dutch government is committed to the development and implementation of agreements between companies, social organizations, trade unions and government in the field of International Corporate Social Responsibility (IMVO) and it granted a subsidy of EUR 996.346to ensure a structured and professional involvement of civil society and trade unions in the preparation of IMVO covenants in the Netherlands. The subsidy is Intended for Dutch based established civil society organizations involved in the IMVO Covenant negotiations. The current covenant trajectories are on: Nutrition, insurers, gold, floriculture, sustainable natural stone. The administration of the funds is operated by Oxfam Novib on request of the MVO Platform and the Ministry.

participating-org.narrative: Nederlandse Vereniging tot Bescherming van Dieren

The Dutch Association for Animal Welfare (Dierenbescherming - Nederlandse Vereniging tot Bescherming van Dieren) is a Dutch organization, built on volunteers, dedicated since 1864 to protect animals. Today, the Dierenbescherming has about 180,000 supporters (members, donors, volunteers), making it the largest organization in the Netherlands, which focuses primarily on animal welfare. The "Dierenbescherming" defends the interests of all animals, including pets, farm animals, wild life and laboratory animals. They take on two principles. The first argues that animals have their own intrinsic value. The animal should be treated as an independent being with feelings and consciousness, and therefore should be treated with respect. The second states that man has the duty to protect and treat animals well. In addition to practical activities (including inspections, animal shelters and ambulances) and education, the Dierenbescherming also engages in lobbying activities and actions. Thanks to the Dierenbescherming, the legislation for farm and laboratory animals has greatly enhanced.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector and/or on promotion of financial inclusion of people living in poverty.
